Docs.summary: Return the XML tag name for the given policy identifier.

Docs.summary: Value for #getHeadlessDeviceOwnerMode which indicates that this DPC should be provisioned into "affiliated" mode when on a Headless System User Mode device.

remarks.para: Value for #getHeadlessDeviceOwnerMode which indicates that this DPC should be provisioned into "affiliated" mode when on a Headless System User Mode device.
This mode adds a Profile Owner to all users other than the user the Device Owner is on.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses UsesEncryptedStorage = (7)

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: A type of policy that this device admin can use: require encryption of stored data.

remarks.para: A type of policy that this device admin can use: require encryption of stored data.
To control this policy, the device admin must have a "encrypted-storage" tag in the "uses-policies" section of its meta-data.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool UsesPolicy(valuetype Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses policyIdent) cil managed

Docs.summary: Return true if the device admin has requested that it be able to use the given policy control.

remarks.para: Return true if the device admin has requested that it be able to use the given policy control. The possible policy identifier inputs are: #USES_POLICY_LIMIT_PASSWORD, #USES_POLICY_WATCH_LOGIN, #USES_POLICY_RESET_PASSWORD, #USES_POLICY_FORCE_LOCK, #USES_POLICY_WIPE_DATA, #USES_POLICY_EXPIRE_PASSWORD, #USES_ENCRYPTED_STORAGE, #USES_POLICY_DISABLE_CAMERA.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses UsesPolicyDisableCamera = (8)

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: A type of policy that this device admin can use: disables use of all device cameras.

remarks.para: A type of policy that this device admin can use: disables use of all device cameras.

To control this policy, the device admin must be a device owner or profile owner, and must have a "disable-camera" tag in the "uses-policies" section of its meta-data. If used by a device owner, the policy affects all users on the device.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses UsesPolicyDisableKeyguardFeatures = (9)

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: A type of policy that this device admin can use: disables use of keyguard features.

remarks.para: A type of policy that this device admin can use: disables use of keyguard features.

To control this policy, the device admin must be a device owner or profile owner, and must have a "disable-keyguard-features" tag in the "uses-policies" section of its meta-data. If used by a device owner, the policy only affects the primary user and its profiles, but not any secondary users on the device.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses UsesPolicyExpirePassword = (6)

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: A type of policy that this device admin can use: force the user to change their password after an administrator-defined time limit.

remarks.para: A type of policy that this device admin can use: force the user to change their password after an administrator-defined time limit.

To control this policy, the device admin must be a device owner or profile owner, and must have an "expire-password" tag in the "uses-policies" section of its meta-data. If used by a device owner, the policy only affects the primary user and its profiles, but not any secondary users on the device.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses UsesPolicyForceLock = (3)

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: A type of policy that this device admin can use: able to force the device to lock viaDevicePolicyManager#lockNow or limit the maximum lock timeout for the device via DevicePolicyManager#setMaximumTimeToLock.

remarks.para: A type of policy that this device admin can use: able to force the device to lock viaDevicePolicyManager#lockNow or limit the maximum lock timeout for the device via DevicePolicyManager#setMaximumTimeToLock.
To control this policy, the device admin must have a "force-lock" tag in the "uses-policies" section of its meta-data.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses UsesPolicyLimitPassword = (0)

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: A type of policy that this device admin can use: limit the passwords that the user can select, via DevicePolicyManager#setPasswordQuality and DevicePolicyManager#setPasswordMinimumLength.

remarks.para: A type of policy that this device admin can use: limit the passwords that the user can select, via DevicePolicyManager#setPasswordQuality and DevicePolicyManager#setPasswordMinimumLength.

To control this policy, the device admin must be a device owner or profile owner, and must have a "limit-password" tag in the "uses-policies" section of its meta-data. If used by a device owner, the policy only affects the primary user and its profiles, but not any secondary users on the device.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses UsesPolicyResetPassword = (2)

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: A type of policy that this device admin can use: able to reset the user's password via DevicePolicyManager#resetPassword.

remarks.para: A type of policy that this device admin can use: able to reset the user's password via DevicePolicyManager#resetPassword.
To control this policy, the device admin must have a "reset-password" tag in the "uses-policies" section of its meta-data.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses UsesPolicyWatchLogin = (1)

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: A type of policy that this device admin can use: able to watch login attempts from the user, via DeviceAdminReceiver#ACTION_PASSWORD_FAILED, DeviceAdminReceiver#ACTION_PASSWORD_SUCCEEDED, and DevicePolicyManager#getCurrentFailedPasswordAttempts.

remarks.para: A type of policy that this device admin can use: able to watch login attempts from the user, via DeviceAdminReceiver#ACTION_PASSWORD_FAILED, DeviceAdminReceiver#ACTION_PASSWORD_SUCCEEDED, and DevicePolicyManager#getCurrentFailedPasswordAttempts.
To control this policy, the device admin must have a "watch-login" tag in the "uses-policies" section of its meta-data.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses UsesPolicyWipeData = (4)

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Admin.DeviceAdminUses enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: A type of policy that this device admin can use: able to factory reset the device, erasing all of the user's data, via DevicePolicyManager#wipeData.

remarks.para: A type of policy that this device admin can use: able to factory reset the device, erasing all of the user's data, via DevicePolicyManager#wipeData.
To control this policy, the device admin must have a "wipe-data" tag in the "uses-policies" section of its meta-data.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
